relation: Great for these types of students
Campus police are everywhere all the time. This is a very safe campus. You get to know the police very well.
Too many to name. There is something for everyone and if there isn't one, you can create one.
Several new buildings offering new majors with state of the art technology. What a great school! I can't imagine being anywhere else.
Lots of clubs and intramerals. Things going on several nights. Plenty of areas to just go out and play, walk around, sit around or whatever. Never boring.
Excellent. For the money you get a huge amount of food. Many choices and a few different places to go.
Not too bad. Air conditioned rooms, which is nice. It is all in what you make of it. Plenty of room for all your things.
Classes haven't been to difficult. As long as you make time to study and do your homework, you shouldn't have any problems. Tutors are available all the time if needed.
Great teachers and classes. Plenty of food! Teachers are always willing to help and listen.
This school is a very open and beautiful campus. I feel so at home here. RMU is always growing in the most positive ways and i am so glad to be part of it.
pageTitle: Robert Morris University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

Reviewer has been to campus. 14 out of 15 people found this review useful. 1 of 51 Stephanie from West Newton, PA Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Dorm Life Living on campus was the best choice I ever made. I have made the best friends of my life in the semester I have been a resident student at RMU. And even beyond that, the Student Life department does a very good job of ensuring there are things to do on campus. Primarily we screen a movie almost every Friday and we have open mic every Tuesday night. Then, there's almost always something more. Also, a lot of the dorms will host their own events. Academic Rigor My experience may be slightly swayed because I'm a media arts student and my first semester included a communication skills course, a math course, intro to psychology, and an art and a video course. So, the communication skills class was the only traditionally rigorous course (assignments and papers), while the art courses were a drawing per week or the production elements of a project. But, from my experience in my first week of my second semester, I'm seeing that this will be a more rigorous set or courses for me. So, it varies but overall the work can be a challenge, but I don't believe it could ever bury you. And in any such case, we offer free tutoring services. Tips for prospective students Really get involved
